attachments.title: Scientific Software Research Faculty Award

elements.text: This is a funding opportunity to support a USA-based research position that was shared on the Research Software Alliance Slack. No citizenship or country requirements apply.
The Simons Foundation’s Math and Physical Sciences division has just announced a new funding opportunity for scientific software-oriented researchers: The Scientific Software Research Faculty Award.

The award is a 5 year grant that provides 50% salary support for applicants to begin new Research Professor[1] positions in scientific domain departments, currently limited to the physical sciences (physics, astronomy, mathematics). For these positions, it is expected that a maximum of 50% of time will be spent teaching, doing service work, or supporting the computational efforts of the department, and 50% of time is for scientific software development and maintenance efforts as a faculty member.

The foundation expects this to be a yearly call, and at full capacity expects to support an average of 6 new awardees each year. More information about the application process and scope of the award is available in the link above. Please reach out to Elizabeth Roy (Senior Manager for Programs and Administration) with any questions or inquiries:

. Applicants must have a Ph.D. (or equivalent degree) in mathematics, astronomy or theoretical physics and have played a leading role in developing or maintaining scientific software in one or more of these fields. Awards may be hosted at any public or private Ph.D.-granting institution in the United States. There are no citizenship or country requirements to apply.

[1] Different universities will use different titles for these roles, such as “clinical professor,” “professor of practice” or “research professor.” (edited)
